TITLE: Mansions in Boca Raton are commanding Miami Beach prices. Here's a look inside
SUMMARY: Ultra-high-end real estate in Boca Raton, Florida, is on a stratospheric rise, breaking record sale prices every year for five consecutive years.

TITLE: 'I might have to sleep in my crappy car': Self-made millionaire Bethenny Frankel shares the mindsets that helped her achieve success
SUMMARY: "Success is achievable for anyone who wants to put in old-school effort and hard work," says self-made millionaire Bethenny Frankel. She shares the key mindsets that helped her stay mentally strong and driven throughout her career.

TITLE: Capital gains may have triggered hundreds of billions more in individual taxes for 2021, analysis shows. How to trim your tax bill
SUMMARY: Individuals paid significantly more taxes this season, and the surge in capital gains in 2021 may be to blame, according to the Penn Wharton Budget Model.

TITLE: Still missing your tax refund? You'll soon receive 5% interest — but it’s taxable
SUMMARY: If you're still waiting for a tax refund, you may receive 5% interest starting July 1, 2022, according to the IRS. Here's what else to know.

TITLE: Op-ed: The housing shortage will actually benefit homebuilder stocks. Here are some companies to watch
SUMMARY: Rumors of the homebuilding industry's weaknesses have been greatly exaggerated. The current battered condition of these stocks is actually an opportunity.

TITLE: 'Tax us now': Millionaires call on the global elite to tax them more
SUMMARY: A group of over 150 millionaires are calling on the elite attendees of this year's World Economic Forum in Davos, to tax them more.

TITLE: Here's what the rich will be reading this summer: Books on leadership, Greek myths and Miyazaki
SUMMARY: J.P. Morgan Private Bank announced its 23rd annual summer reading list, which has become the seasonal "it list" of literary status symbols.

TITLE: The number of billionaires soared during the pandemic. How tax proposals aim to reduce wealth inequality
SUMMARY: As the number of billionaires has grown since the pandemic started, calls to "tax the rich" have increased. Here's how those levies may work.

TITLE: Tax breaks aren’t prime reason for high-net-worth philanthropy, study finds
SUMMARY: Tax breaks aren't the primary incentive for philanthropy among the ultra-wealthy, according to a charitable giving study.

TITLE: Four 'dream jobs' for people who love to travel
SUMMARY: CNBC Travel spoke with people from four industries about occupations where working from home — or an office for that matter — isn't an option.

TITLE: Oxfam calls for an end to billionaire 'bonanza,' says millions are falling into extreme poverty
SUMMARY: There were 573 more billionaires in the world by March 2022 than in 2020, Oxfam said, estimating that 263 million could be pushed into extreme poverty in 2022.

TITLE: Creating a special needs trust? Here are the costs, what you need to know and who to use
SUMMARY: It's imperative that families shelter assets in special needs trusts to ensure impaired loved ones do not lose life-saving government financial support.

TITLE: Want to change the world? Bill Gates says you should 'read a lot' and 'find a skill you enjoy'
SUMMARY: During a Reddit "Ask Me Anything" session, the billionaire Microsoft co-founder was asked what advice he'd offer to a young person looking to "make a positive impact on this world."

TITLE: Jeff Bezos keeps a 16-year-old framed magazine as a 'reminder' that Amazon's most profitable service was once just a 'risky bet'
SUMMARY: This week, Amazon founder Jeff Bezos tweeted an old magazine cover that deemed Amazon Web Services a risky bet. Now, AWS makes over $62 per year.

TITLE: Crypto as currency: managing your financial life using digital coins
SUMMARY: It's possible to live off of a salary paid in cryptocurrency but advisors caution clients virtual coins don't offer the same protections as cash or stocks.

TITLE: Reality TV shows based on real estate are 'horrible' for the industry, says brokerage CEO
SUMMARY: Bess Freedman, CEO of Brown Harris Stevens, took aim at the rise of shows like Netflix's "Selling Sunset" and Bravo's "Million Dollar Listing."

TITLE: A 1955 Mercedes just nabbed $143 million at auction, making it the most expensive car ever sold
SUMMARY: The 1955 Mercedes-Benz 300 SLR Uhlenhaut Coupe smashed the previous record for the most expensive car sold at auction by more than $95 million.

TITLE: Mark Cuban says he supports President Biden's $10,000 student loan debt proposal: 'It has to be fixed'
SUMMARY: The billionaire Dallas Mavericks owner is outspoken about student loan debt — and he's on board with President Biden's proposal to forgive $10,000 per borrower.

TITLE: House Democrats push for state and local taxes relief in appropriations bill
SUMMARY: Five House Democrats are still fighting for relief on the $10,000 limit on the federal deduction for state and local taxes through the appropriations process.

TITLE: Taylor Swift's advice for young people: Hearing the word 'no' was 'more crucial than the moments I was told yes'
SUMMARY: Taylor Swift's music career has been accompanied by plenty of rejection and missteps. Her advice to NYU's class of 2022: Embrace and learn from those experiences.

TITLE: Women are still paid 83 cents for every dollar men earn. Here’s why
SUMMARY: The gender wage gap persists despite improvements over the last several decades.

TITLE: For the first time since the pandemic, leisure and business flights surpass 2019 levels
SUMMARY: Global leisure and business flights topped pre-pandemic levels for the first time this spring, despite rising costs and geopolitical uncertainty.

TITLE: Op-ed: Investors need to keep their emotions under control in this volatile market
SUMMARY: Although no one can predict what is going to happen next, there are strategies that investors can consider to help manage their portfolios through volatility.

TITLE: Just 2% of the richest Americans had their taxes audited in 2019, down from 16% in 2010
SUMMARY: The main reason for the decline in the audit rate is a lack of IRS funding, according to a GAO report.

TITLE: Why Kevin O'Leary makes his life and money decisions the same way: 'I live life with a portfolio approach'
SUMMARY: "Shark Tank" star Kevin O'Leary says his bad days are relatively easy to handle, due to the decision-making process he uses for both life and money decisions.

TITLE: Op-ed: Energy and health care are attractive sectors to watch the rest of the year
SUMMARY: Expect mid-to-late cycle dynamics to play out once the inflation scare recedes, meaning financial, energy and materials companies will do best.

TITLE: Why Tim Cook says college grads should prioritize making a difference: 'Leading a company and a good life are not the same thing'
SUMMARY: At Gallaudet’s Undergraduate Commencement Ceremony on Friday, Apple CEO Tim Cook shared his advice on leading a powerful company—and a meaningful life.

TITLE: Inflation is the ‘top problem’ facing America, with no other issue coming close, survey shows
SUMMARY: Amid swelling prices, most Americans see inflation as the biggest issue facing the country — far exceeding other concerns, according to a survey.

TITLE: Steve Jobs used his vacation time to bombard Apple staffers with phone calls, says iPod's creator — here's why
SUMMARY: Former Apple vice president Tony Fadell says that even Steve Jobs was on vacation, he'd constantly call his staffers to brainstorm new ideas. Here's why.

TITLE: This flashy Bel Air mansion that was listed at $87.8 million flopped at auction — and now the seller is furious
SUMMARY: "Horrible, Horrible, Horrible!" was how the seller, who filed for Chapter 11 last year, characterized the auction results to CNBC.
